description: Few-shot examples for reasoning patterns with Wikipedia research

examples.question: Who is the current president of Sri Lanka?

thinking_examples.thinking:
**Understanding the Request**
The user wants to know who is currently serving as president of Sri Lanka.

**Planning My Approach**
Since my training data has a cutoff date and may not have the most current information about world leaders, I need to search Wikipedia to get the latest information about Sri Lanka's current president.

**Analyzing the Results**
I see search results that include 'President of Sri Lanka' which should have current information. Let me read this page to find who is currently serving.

**Planning the Next Step**
I'll call get_wikipedia_page to read the 'President of Sri Lanka' article.
thinking_examples.title: President of Sri Lanka

thinking_examples.thinking:
**Analyzing What I Learned**
I found out that the current president of Sri Lanka is Anura Kumara Dissanayake. I need to find more information about him to provide a complete answer.

**Planning the Next Step**
I'll search for 'Anura Kumara Dissanayake' on Wikipedia to read his bio page.

**Analyzing the Results**
I found the article named 'Anura Kumara Dissanayake' from the search results. Let me read this article to find more information about him.

**Planning the Next Step**
I'll call get_wikipedia_page to read his biography.
thinking_examples.title: Anura Kumara Dissanayake

thinking_examples.thinking:
**Synthesizing the Information**
I've found the information about the current president of Sri Lanka. From the Wikipedia page for 'President of Sri Lanka,' it clearly states that Anura Kumara Dissanayake is the current president, having assumed office on September 23, 2024. This is very recent information that occurred after my training data cutoff. From his biographical page, I can see he's the 10th president and was elected in the 2024 presidential election.

**Preparing the Answer**
Now I have comprehensive information from both pages and can provide a complete answer.
thinking_examples.content: The current president of Sri Lanka is Anura Kumara Dissanayake (commonly known as AKD), who assumed office on September 23, 2024, after winning the 2024 presidential election. He represents the National People's Power (NPP) coalition and is notable for being the first Sri Lankan president elected in a second round of vote counting, as well as the first president not affiliated with the country's traditional political parties.

examples.question: Who is the current Prime Minister of Canada?

thinking_examples.thinking:
**Understanding the Request**
The user wants to know who is currently serving as Prime Minister of Canada.

**Planning My Approach**
I need to search Wikipedia to get current information about Canada's Prime Minister since political positions can change.

**Analyzing the Results**
I see search results including 'Prime Minister of Canada' which should list the current officeholder.

**Planning the Next Step**
I'll read the 'Prime Minister of Canada' article to get current information.
thinking_examples.title: Prime Minister of Canada

thinking_examples.thinking:
**Analyzing What I Learned**
I found that the current Prime Minister of Canada is Justin Trudeau. To provide a more complete answer about him, I should also read his biographical page.

**Planning the Next Step**
I'll search for 'Justin Trudeau' on Wikipedia to read his biography.

**Analyzing the Results**
I found the 'Justin Trudeau' article. Let me read it to get more information about his background and tenure.

**Planning the Next Step**
I'll call get_wikipedia_page to read his biography.
thinking_examples.title: Justin Trudeau

thinking_examples.thinking:
**Synthesizing the Information**
I've gathered comprehensive information. From the 'Prime Minister of Canada' page, I confirmed Justin Trudeau is the current Prime Minister. From his biography, I learned he has been in office since November 2015, making him one of Canada's longest-serving Prime Ministers in recent history.

**Preparing the Answer**
Now I have enough information to provide a complete answer.
thinking_examples.content: The current Prime Minister of Canada is Justin Trudeau, who has been serving since November 4, 2015. He is the leader of the Liberal Party and the 23rd Prime Minister of Canada. Trudeau took office following the 2015 federal election and has been re-elected twice, though his most recent government formed a minority government.

examples.question: What is the current population of Tokyo?

thinking_examples.thinking:
**Understanding the Request**
The user wants to know the current population of Tokyo.

**Planning My Approach**
Population figures change over time, so I should search Wikipedia for the most current information.

**Analyzing the Results**
I see search results including 'Tokyo' and 'Demographics of Tokyo' which should have population information.

**Planning the Next Step**
I'll read the 'Tokyo' article to find current population data.
thinking_examples.title: Tokyo

thinking_examples.thinking:
**Analyzing What I Learned**
I found population data in the Tokyo article. For more detailed and current statistics, I should also check if there's a more specific article about Tokyo's demographics.

**Planning the Next Step**
I'll search for 'Tokyo metropolitan area population' to get more detailed figures.

**Synthesizing the Information**
I now have comprehensive population data for Tokyo. From the main Tokyo article, I have the city proper population, and from the additional search, I can clarify the distinction between Tokyo's city population and the greater metropolitan area.

**Preparing the Answer**
I have enough information to provide an accurate answer about Tokyo's population.
thinking_examples.content: Tokyo has a population of approximately 14 million people within its city limits, making it one of the world's largest cities. However, the greater Tokyo metropolitan area (Tokyo Metropolis) has a population of over 37 million people, making it the largest metropolitan area in the world by population.

examples.question: Who won the most recent FIFA World Cup?

thinking_examples.thinking:
**Understanding the Request**
The user wants to know who won the most recent FIFA World Cup.

**Planning My Approach**
The World Cup is held every 4 years and the most recent one was in 2022. I should search Wikipedia to confirm and get details.

**Analyzing the Results**
I see search results confirming Argentina won the 2022 FIFA World Cup. Let me read the main article to get more details about the tournament and final match.

**Planning the Next Step**
I'll read the '2022 FIFA World Cup' article for comprehensive information.
thinking_examples.title: 2022 FIFA World Cup

thinking_examples.thinking:
**Analyzing What I Learned**
I found detailed information about the 2022 World Cup. Argentina defeated France in the final. I should also get information about Argentina's national team and their star player Lionel Messi.

**Planning the Next Step**
I'll search for 'Argentina national football team' to provide context about the winning team.
thinking_examples.query: Argentina national football team World Cup 2022

thinking_examples.thinking:
**Synthesizing the Information**
I've gathered comprehensive information about the 2022 FIFA World Cup. Argentina won their third World Cup title by defeating France in a memorable final that went to penalties. Lionel Messi, in what many consider his final World Cup appearance, won the Golden Ball award.

**Preparing the Answer**
I have enough information to provide a complete answer.
thinking_examples.content: Argentina won the most recent FIFA World Cup in 2022, held in Qatar. In a historic final against France, Argentina won 4-2 on penalties after the match ended 3-3 following extra time. This was Argentina's third World Cup title, and the tournament was particularly notable as it featured Lionel Messi's first World Cup victory, cementing his legacy as one of the greatest footballers of all time.

examples.question: What is the latest iPhone model?

thinking_examples.thinking:
**Understanding the Request**
The user wants to know about the latest iPhone model.

**Planning My Approach**
Technology products change frequently, so I need to search Wikipedia for the most current information about iPhone models.

**Analyzing the Results**
I see search results for iPhone 15 and iPhone 16. Let me check which is the most recent model.

**Planning the Next Step**
I'll read the 'iPhone' article to see the complete list of models and identify the latest one.
thinking_examples.title: iPhone

thinking_examples.thinking:
**Analyzing What I Learned**
I found that the iPhone 15 series was released in September 2023. I should also check for any 2024 releases.

**Planning the Next Step**
I'll search for 'iPhone 16' to see if there's a newer model.

**Synthesizing the Information**
I've gathered information about iPhone models. The iPhone 15 series (released September 2023) appears to be the latest as of early 2024. The iPhone 15 Pro Max is the top-of-the-line model with the A17 Pro chip.

**Preparing the Answer**
I have enough information to provide an accurate answer.
thinking_examples.content: The latest iPhone model is the iPhone 15 series, released in September 2023. The lineup includes iPhone 15, iPhone 15 Plus, iPhone 15 Pro, and iPhone 15 Pro Max. Key features include the Dynamic Island design (previously only on Pro models), a 48-megapixel main camera on all models, and the A16 Bionic chip on standard models with the A17 Pro chip on Pro models. The iPhone 15 Pro Max also features a 5x optical zoom lens, a first for iPhones.

current_leaders.description: When researching current leaders (presidents, prime ministers, etc.), you MUST read both their official position page AND their personal biography page

current_events.description: For current events, read the main article about the event

technology_products.description: For technology products, read the main product article

forbidden_patterns: Providing answers without calling Wikipedia tools for current information
Only reading one page when researching current leaders (position OR biography, not both)
Using cached knowledge for current information
Skipping thinking blocks before or after tool calls
